intro: Streptocarpus heckmannianus, commonly known as the Madagascar streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, spurred flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental flowers. Streptocarpus heckmannianus is also valued for its ability to produce numerous blooms throughout the growing season.
